TopicTitle: Terrain Scatters - how common are they?+

Articles.Content:
So I recently upgraded from a potato to a computer, and I decided to make KSP look pretty.

Terrain detail is high instead of low, installed Scatterer and EVE, and enabled and set terrain scatter to 100%.

Eve and scatterer are working fine, but I went ot one of my saves... checked around KSC, around the mountains west of KSC, at one of my craft near KSC 2, 2 different mun landing sites (from craft already landed there), and my duna surface base.

I haven't seen a single tree or rock.

Do any of the visual mods interfere with the terrain scatter display?

Do I need to restart KSC?

Were the scatters never that common, and I'm just unlucky?

I suggest going beyond the flat area of the  KSC and into the hills and then reloading. Usually scatters don't spawn as you go but rather generate on spawn. So reload once outside of the KSC area, and make sure not to be in any special area such as KSC2.

The grasslands just west of KSC are supposed to have sparse trees with terrain scatter. You have to be below 4000m to see them, IIRC.

If you really want to test the limits of your new machine, though -- there is a fork where 3 rivers meet, just north of the Great Desert. Try flying there.

(If I recall the right spot: in the cheat menu, with "Show Flight Debug Stats" turned on, it says Lat = 45, Lon = -146.) Thousands of trees there, on a flat plain. Bogged the hell out of my machine when I did basically the same test you are doing.
